item.title: Zepto IPO: Company To File Draft Papers In March-April; All You Need To Know - News18
item.description:
Zepto IPO: Company To File Draft Papers In March-April; All You Need To Know

Last Updated: January 04, 2025, 19:32 IST

Quick commerce platform Zepto is gearing up to file its initial public offering (IPO) draft papers by March or April 2025, according to a report by The Economic Times. The company has permission to relocate its base from Singapore to India ahead of the public listing.

  • A critical board meeting on January 19 will finalise aspects of the IPO, including the appointment of bankers and determining the IPO size.
  • Data on the grey market premium will be available once the IPO process starts.
  • Zepto will become the first quick commerce startup to go public if successful.
  • Zepto is transitioning to a marketplace model, registered as Zepto Marketplace in October 2024.
  • Zepto raised USD 350 million in funding in November 2024 and plans to expand to over 50 cities.
“Zepto reported a 120 per cent increase in operating revenue to Rs 4,454 crore in FY24.”

The IPO process marks a significant step for Zepto as it seeks to expand and solidify its position in the quick commerce market.

item.title: Ripple (XRP) Price Prediction for 2025: Could it break $5? - Crypto Times
item.description:
Ripple (XRP) Price Prediction for 2025: Could it break $5?

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Crypto Times

This article discusses the bullish sentiment surrounding Ripple (XRP) and the potential for its price to reach new heights in 2025, particularly the possibility of breaking $5. Investors are optimistic following recent gains and the successful launch of the RLUSD stablecoin.

  • XRP has surged over 300% since November, now trading around $2.45.
  • Analysts predict XRP could reach $3 and possibly $5 if the bullish trend continues.
  • The upcoming presidential term of Donald Trump could further boost the crypto market.
  • Key resistance level for XRP is at $2.50, with strong support at $2.00.
  • Market sentiment is optimistic for ripple and other cryptocurrencies in 2025.

“2025 is going to be most important for this altcoin as it now has no barriers against attaining huge price gains.”

In conclusion, if XRP maintains its bullish momentum, it could potentially break previous all-time highs, with a target of over $5 in 2025.

item.title: Vedanta shares: Is this a stock to buy after Q3 metal production update? | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Vedanta Shares: Is This a Stock to Buy After Q3 Metal Production Update?

Publication Date: January 3, 2024   Source: Live Mint

Vedanta Limited released its third quarter production data, showing mixed performance in various segments with key highlights in Zinc and Aluminium production.

  • Zinc production in India decreased by 2% YoY to 265,000 tonnes.
  • Total Aluminium production increased by 3% YoY to 614,000 tonnes.
  • Oil and gas production saw a dip of 19% YoY to 99.4 kboepd.
  • Vedanta shares closed 1.8% higher at ₹457.90 after the market update.
“Vedanta Ltd showcased a mixed bag of performance in its Q3 FY25 operational update, with notable achievements and some challenges across key business verticals.” - Anshul Jain, Head of Research at Lakshmishree Investment and Securities

Investors are advised to consider holding the shares with a stop loss below ₹438, and fresh investors might initiate buying for a short-term target of ₹500.

item.title: Cryptocurrency Prices Today Jan 4: Bitcoin at $98K, ICP and EOS Surge 15% - CoinGape
item.description:
Cryptocurrency Prices Today Jan 4: Bitcoin at $98K, ICP and EOS Surge 15%

Date: January 4, 2024 Source: CoinGape

The cryptocurrency market is experiencing a bullish trend as Bitcoin rallies sharply to $98K, coinciding with its 16th anniversary. Altcoins like ICP and EOS also see significant gains.

  • Bitcoin price reached $98,267, up 1.26% in 24 hours.
  • ICP and EOS prices surged by 15% each.
  • Global cryptocurrency market cap increased by 2.31% to $3.49 trillion.

item.title: Mainboard IPOs in December 2024: A mixed trend for newly listed stocks, a look at top 5 performers - Upstox
item.description:
Mainboard IPOs in December 2024: A mixed trend for newly listed stocks, a look at top 5 performers

Publication Date: January 3, 2025 | Source: Upstox

The last month of 2024 was a busy period for primary market investors with 30 mainboard and SME IPOs launched in December, raising nearly ₹1.9 crore. 15 mainboard IPOs were listed, with a positive trend as 13 stocks traded higher than their IPO prices.

  1. Mamata Machinery had a stellar debut, listing at ₹600 against an issue price of ₹243, currently trading at ₹545, up 133.41% from its IPO.
  2. One MobiKwik Systems debuted at ₹440, significantly rising above its issue price of ₹279, currently trading at ₹602.
  3. Unimech Aerospace listed at ₹1,460, down to ₹1,429.95, maintaining a gain of 85.62% from its issue price of ₹785.
  4. Transrail Lighting debuted at ₹590 and is currently trading at ₹626.55, reflecting a near 49% gain.
  5. Senores Pharmaceuticals is trading at ₹577.5, up 46.52% from its issue price of ₹391.

While Suraksha Diagnostic and Carraro India posted negative returns, the rest showed gains of over 40%.

"The stock positioning in the industry indicates potential further price appreciation for various companies."

Overall, December saw a trending positive for newly listed stocks, suggesting a robust appetite for IPOs despite some fluctuations.

item.title: Indo Farm Equipment IPO: Here's How You Can Check Allotment Status Online - ABP Live
item.description:
Indo Farm Equipment IPO: Here's How You Can Check Allotment Status Online

Publication Date: 04 Jan 2025
Source: ABP Live

Investors can check the allotment status of the Indo Farm Equipment IPO online via the BSE, NSE websites, or the official portal of the IPO registrar, Mas Services.

  • The bidding for Indo Farm Equipment's IPO concluded with strong demand on January 4, 2025.
  • The IPO share allotment details will be available on the same date.
  • Shares are expected to be listed on stock exchanges on January 7, 2025.
  • The price band for the IPO is set between Rs 204 and Rs 215 per share.
  • The total amount raised through the IPO is Rs 260.15 crore.
"Investors can check the IPO allotment status online via the BSE, NSE websites, or the official portal of the IPO registrar, Mas Services."

This IPO is significant for investors looking to learn about their allotment status and is indicative of strong market interest.

item.title: Kirloskar Oil Engines file appeal before SAT challenging SEBI order to disclose family settlement deed | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Kirloskar Oil Engines Appeals SEBI Order on Family Settlement Disclosure

Date: December 31, 2024 Source: Live Mint

Kirloskar Industries Ltd has filed an appeal challenging a SEBI order requiring disclosure of a family settlement deed.

  • The appeal was made to the Securities Appellate Tribunal (SAT) against SEBI's directive.
  • SEBI's order dates back to December 30, 2024, and concerns a deed dated September 11, 2009.
  • The existence of the deed's binding nature on Kirloskar companies is under litigation since 2018.
  • Kirloskar Industries claims SEBI's decision contains inaccuracies and disregards legal principles.
“The question of whether the DFS is binding on the Kirloskar companies is pending before the Civil Court since 2018, and despite this SEBI has opined on matters that are sub-judice.”

This appeal highlights ongoing legal disputes and the complexities surrounding corporate regulations.

item.title: Standard Glass Lining IPO opens Monday: What GMP signals ahead of subscription - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Standard Glass Lining IPO opens Monday: What GMP signals ahead of subscription

Publication Date: Not specified; Source: CNBC TV18

The initial public offering (IPO) of Standard Glass Lining Technology Ltd. is set to open for subscription on January 6 and conclude on January 8. Prior to launching the IPO, the company has successfully raised ₹123.02 crore from various anchor investors.

  • The IPO price band is fixed at ₹133-140 per share.
  • The grey market premium (GMP) stands at approximately ₹88, indicating a 63% premium over the issue price.
  • Standard Glass Lining's IPO consists of a fresh issue of up to ₹210 crore and an offer for sale of up to 1.42 crore equity shares.
  • The proceeds from the fresh issue will be used for debt payments and investments in a subsidiary.
  • The allotment for the IPO is expected to be finalised on January 9, with a listing date of January 13, 2025.
"Standard Glass Lining offers comprehensive solutions that encompass design, engineering, manufacturing, assembly, installation, and commissioning for pharmaceutical and chemical manufacturers on a turnkey basis."

This IPO represents the first mainboard IPO of 2025 and is expected to attract significant interest from various types of investors.

item.title: HDFC Bank gets RBI nod to acquire up to 9.5% stake in AU Small Finance Bank - The Economic Times
item.description:
HDFC Bank gets RBI nod to acquire up to 9.5% stake in AU Small Finance Bank

Publication Date: Not specified in the article

Source: Economic Times

HDFC Bank, India's largest private sector lender, has received the Reserve Bank of India’s approval to acquire up to 9.5% stake in AU Small Finance Bank Limited within one year. This approval extends to HDFC Bank and its group companies.

  • AU SFB announced the RBI approval in a regulatory filing.
  • The acquisition is open for HDFC Bank and its group entities, which includes HDFC Mutual Fund and HDFC Life Insurance.
  • AU SFB shares closed at Rs 574, while HDFC Bank shares were at Rs 1,748.40.
  • AU Small Finance Bank reported a 42% rise in net profit for the September quarter, totaling Rs 571 crore.
  • The bank's net interest margin improved to 6.1% and net interest income increased by 58% year-on-year.
  • However, asset quality showed deterioration with the gross non-performing assets ratio rising to 1.98%.
“The bank made higher provisions at Rs 373 crore for the quarter when compared with Rs 95 crore in the year-ago period.”

In conclusion, this acquisition signals HDFC Bank's ongoing strategy to strengthen its position in the financial sector, despite challenges in asset quality for AU Small Finance Bank.

item.description:

item.title: Here is why Suzlon Energy shares will be in focus on Monday - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Suzlon Energy Shares Set to Attract Attention on Monday

Publication date: [Insert Date] Source: CNBCTV18

Suzlon Energy Ltd.'s shares are poised to be in focus on the upcoming trading session due to a recent demand from the Ahmedabad Income Tax Department.

  • The company has received an Income Tax demand of ₹1.01 crore for FY2017.
  • This demand is linked to a penalty concerning late payments related to employee contributions to PF/ESI during FY 2016-17.
  • Suzlon plans to appeal the penalty and is optimistic about a favorable resolution.
  • The Income Tax Department had previously waived a total penalty of ₹260.35 crore for earlier dues, following a favorable ruling by the ITAT.
  • Shares closed down by 1.38% on the previous Friday, at ₹62.05, but have appreciated over 60% in the past year.
Suzlon Energy: "We are confident of achieving a favorable outcome from the appeal."

The market will be watching Suzlon Energy closely as it navigates this tax issue, particularly given its recent performance and the implications for investor confidence.

item.title: EPFO withdrawal from ATM to become a reality soon. Here's how it will work | Mint - Mint
item.description:
EPFO Withdrawal from ATMs Set to Launch Soon

Publication Date: Recent Source: Live Mint

Good news for over seven crore of the Employees’ Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) subscribers. Members of the retirement fund body EPFO may soon be able to withdraw their provident fund (PF) money directly from ATMs after the settlement.

EPFO ATM Card Launch Date

EPFO will introduce its cutting-edge software system by June of this year, EPFO 3.0, according to Union Labour Minister Mansukh Mandaviya. Following the release of EPFO 3.0, EPFO will also provide ATM cards to its members.

EPFO ATM Card Benefits

  • EPFO subscribers will receive dedicated cards that can be used at ATMs to withdraw savings.
  • The new system allows claimants, beneficiaries, or insured individuals to access their claim amounts through ATMs.
  • Under the EPFO's Employees' Deposit Linked Insurance (EDLI) scheme, heirs of deceased subscribers are provided with a maximum of ₹7 lakh.
  • In the new system, the heir of the deceased EPFO subscriber may also be able to use ATMs to withdraw money after claim settlement.

Current Challenges for EPFO Subscribers

Currently, subscribers of EPFO have to wait 7-10 days for their claims to be settled online, after which the money is transferred to their bank accounts.

The Centralised Pension Payments System (CPPS) has been fully rolled out across all EPFO regional offices. Union Labour Minister Mansukh Mandaviya celebrated the launch, calling it a 'historic milestone'.

"This transformative initiative allows pensioners to access their pensions easily from any bank, any branch, anywhere in the country. It removes the need for physical verification visits and streamlines the pension disbursement process," Mandaviya said.

This rollout sets a new standard in pension service delivery, aligning with our vision of a tech-enabled, member-centric EPFO.

item.title: ₹48 crore per day! Indian CEO Jagdeep Singh's per day income is more than annual revenue of large corporations | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Jagdeep Singh: The World's Highest-Paid CEO Earning ₹48 Crore Daily

Publication Date: Date Not Provided | Source: Live Mint

Indian CEO Jagdeep Singh has achieved an astonishing annual salary of ₹17,500 crore, translating to an average daily income of ₹48 crore, surpassing the annual revenues of many large corporations.

  • Jagdeep Singh is the founder of Quantumscape, a key player in EV battery technology.
  • His journey includes a B.Tech from Stanford and an MBA from UC.
  • Quantumscape has attracted major investments from Bill Gates and Volkswagen.
  • Jagdeep Singh's compensation package includes significant stock options potentially valued at $2.3 billion.
  • Despite stepping down as CEO, he remains a prominent figure in the industry.
“His success is not just about personal wealth; it reflects the potential for innovation and excellence within India's dynamic economic landscape.”

Singh's achievements exemplify the rising influence of Indian talent globally, inspiring many to pursue entrepreneurship.

item.title: Apple CEO Tim Cook to donate $1 million to Donald Trump's inauguration fund: Report - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Tim Cook Donates $1 Million to Trump's Inauguration Fund

Date: Jan 04, 2025 12:29 PM IST | Source: Hindustan Times

Apple CEO Tim Cook will donate $1 million to Donald Trump’s inauguration fund ahead of the swearing-in on January 20. This decision is part of a series of high-profile donations to the inaugural committee.

  • Cook’s donation reflects his belief in the inauguration as a great American tradition.
  • Other companies donating include Amazon, Open AI, and significant automotive firms.
  • Apple is not expected to donate as a corporate entity.
  • The donation coincides with Apple settling a lawsuit for $95 million regarding privacy issues with Siri.
  • Many companies are contributing vehicles and funds for the inauguration event.
“I believe the inauguration is a great American tradition,” said Cook.

Cook’s generous donation continues a trend among influential corporate leaders supporting political events, showcasing the intertwining of business and politics in the U.S.

item.title: 'I won't sell more': EaseMyTrip co-founder Nishant Pitti on Rs 78 crore stake sale - Indian Startup News
item.description:
Nishant Pitti Won't Sell More Shares in EaseMyTrip After CEO Exit

Publication Date: January 3, 2025

Source: Indian Startup News

Nishant Pitti, co-founder of EaseMyTrip, announced on X that he will not sell any further stake in the company after quitting as CEO. He had initially planned to sell his entire 14% stake but ultimately sold only 1.4%.

Nishant Pitti shares post on X

I recently sold a small portion of my promoter shares for personal reasons. I want to assure you this does not reflect any lack of confidence in EaseMyTrip’s bright future. With a talented team and Rikant’s visionary leadership, EaseMyTrip is on a strong growth path.

Who is the new CEO?

Following Pitti's departure, Rikant Pittie has been appointed as the new CEO while Pitti remains as Chairman.

item.description:

item.title: RBI grants approval to HDFC Bank to acquire up to 9.50% stake in AU Small Finance Bank - CNBCTV18
item.description:
RBI Grants Approval to HDFC Bank to Acquire Up to 9.50% Stake in AU Small Finance Bank

Publication Date: January 3, 2025 Source: CNBC TV18

The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has granted approval for HDFC Bank to acquire up to 9.50% stake in AU Small Finance Bank, and also to acquire similar stakes in Kotak Mahindra Bank and Capital Small Finance Bank.

  • HDFC Bank must complete the acquisition within one year from the approval date to retain the approval.
  • The approval covers HDFC Bank and its group entities, including several subsidiaries.
  • HDFC Bank is also cleared to maintain aggregate holdings across specified banks without exceeding 9.50%.
“If the acquisition is not completed within this period, the approval will be cancelled,” said AU Small Finance Bank in an exchange filing.

This move signals strategic growth for HDFC Bank through expansions and partnerships within the Indian banking sector.

item.title: India's Forex Reserves Hit 8-Month Low, Fall $4.11 Billion to $640.27 Billion - News18
item.description:
India's Forex Reserves Hit 8-Month Low, Fall $4.11 Billion to $640.27 Billion

Date: January 04, 2025

Source: News18

India’s foreign exchange (forex) reserves have declined significantly, decreasing by $4.112 billion to an eight-month low of $640.279 billion during the week ending December 27, 2024.

  • The Reserve Bank of India sold $4.641 billion to stabilize the rupee amid ongoing economic pressures.
  • Prior to this week, reserves had already dropped by $8.478 billion.
  • The highest recorded forex reserves were $704.885 billion in September 2024.
  • Foreign currency assets fell by $4.641 billion to $551.921 billion.
  • Gold reserves saw an increase of $541 million, totaling $66.268 billion.
  • The special drawing rights were down by $12 million, while India’s IMF reserve position remained unchanged.
“The forex reserves fell by another $4.112 billion to $640.279 billion as the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) sold $4.641 billion,” said Anil Kumar Bhansali, head of treasury at Finrex Treasury Advisors LLP.

This decline in forex reserves reflects ongoing challenges in the Indian economy, particularly in currency stabilization efforts undertaken by the RBI.
